hints.content:
Each chapter is $\purpleC9$ pages long.

There are $\greenD{63}$ total pages.

[[☃ image 1]]



How many $\blueD{\text{groups}}$ are there?

options.alt: A tape diagram with 2 tapes of unequal lengths, a first tape labeled 63 and a shorter second tape with one part labeled 9. A curved bracket across the bottom and the width of the first tape is labeled with a question mark and the words equal groups. !

hints.content:
We can write this as a multiplication problem. 

$\purpleC{\text{size of the group}}\times\blueD{\text{ number of groups}} = \greenD{\text{ total}}$

So, $\purpleC9\times\blueD{\text{?}} = \greenD{63}$

We can also write this as a division problem. 

$\greenD{\text{total}}\div\purpleC{\text{ size of the groups}}=\blueD{\text{ number of groups}} $

So, $\greenD{63}\div \purpleC9=\blueD{\text{?}}$

The equations that would help us find out how many chapters there are:  

 -   $\purpleC9\times\blueD{\text{?}} = \greenD{63}$
 - $\greenD{63}\div \purpleC9=\blueD{\text{?}}$

question.content:
My favorite book has $63$ pages.  Each chapter is $9$ pages long.

**Which equations would help us find out how many chapters are in my favorite book?**

[[☃ radio 1]]
